levels.title: Introduction to the role of software developer
levels.description: A software developer designs, runs and improves software that meets user needs.
duties: be responsible for writing clean, secure code following a test-driven approach
create code that is open by default and easy for others to reuse

levels.title: Apprentice developer
levels.description: An apprentice developer attends certified training and develops skills on the job.
duties: spend a substantial portion of time shadowing others
work with other developers to write code and tests
build your own knowledge
follow a test-driven approach
write code that is automatically tested

skills.name: Availability and capacity management
skills.skill_level_description: You can describe availability and capacity management processes.

skills.name: Information security
skills.skill_level_description: You are aware of information security and the security controls that can be used to mitigate security threats within solutions and services.

skills.name: Modern standards approach
skills.skill_level_description: You can explain the importance of adopting a modern standards approach.

skills.name: Programming and build (software engineering)
skills.skill_level_description: You can design, code, test, correct and document simple programs or scripts under the direction of others.

skills.name: Prototyping
skills.skill_level_description: You can explain what prototyping is and why and when to use it. You have an understanding of how to work in an open and collaborative environment- for example, by pair-working.

skills.name: Service support
skills.skill_level_description: You can assist in the investigation and resolution of infrastructure problems, undertaking specific activities under the direction of others.

skills.name: User focus
skills.skill_level_description: You know about user experience analysis and its principles. You can explain the purpose of user stories and focus on user needs.

levels.title: Junior developer
levels.description: A junior developer learns on the job by delivering software components.
duties: develop skills while working under supervision to deliver stories in a multidisciplinary team
understand and be proficient in different types of testing
be aware of but not responsible for security
coach and mentor more junior colleagues

skills.name: Availability and capacity management
skills.skill_level_description: You know about availability and capacity management processes.

skills.name: Information security
skills.skill_level_description: You understand information security and the types of security controls that can be used to mitigate security threats within solutions and services.

skills.name: Modern standards approach
skills.skill_level_description: You understand the central principles of modern standards approach and how they apply to the work you are undertaking. You will be able to apply them under guidance.

skills.name: Programming and build (software engineering)
skills.skill_level_description: You can design, code, test, correct and document simple programs or scripts under the direction of others.

skills.name: Prototyping
skills.skill_level_description: You will know when to use a specific prototyping technique or method (for example, sketch, code, Loc2). You can show the value of prototyping to your team.

skills.name: Service support
skills.skill_level_description: You can help fix faults following agreed procedures. You can carry out agreed infrastructure maintenance tasks.

skills.name: Systems design
skills.skill_level_description: You can assist as part of a team on design of components of larger systems.

skills.name: Systems integration
skills.skill_level_description: You can talk about the process of integrating systems and the challenges of designing, building and testing interfaces between systems.

skills.name: User focus
skills.skill_level_description: You know about user experience analysis and its principles. You can explain the purpose of user stories and the focus on user needs.

levels.title: Developer
levels.description: A developer delivers software components that form part of a product.
duties: develop software to meet user needs
follow best-practice guidelines and help to improve those guidelines
write clean, secure and well-tested code
coach and mentor more junior colleagues
operate the services they build and identify issues in production

skills.name: Availability and capacity management
skills.skill_level_description: You can manage the service components to ensure they meet business needs and performance targets.

skills.name: Development process optimisation
skills.skill_level_description: You can explain the importance of developing process efficiency and the common ways in which processes are optimised. You can support specific activities to improve development processes. You can spot or identify obvious deficiencies.

skills.name: Information security
skills.skill_level_description: You can discuss information security. You can design solutions and services with security controls embedded, specifically engineered as mitigation against security threats as a core part of the solutions and services.

skills.name: Modern standards approach
skills.skill_level_description: You can competently use a modern standards approach and guide others in so doing.

skills.name: Programming and build (software engineering)
skills.skill_level_description: You collaborate with others when necessary to review specifications and use these agreed specifications to design, code, test and document programs or scripts of medium to high complexity, using the right standards and tools.

skills.name: Prototyping
skills.skill_level_description: You see prototyping as a team activity, actively soliciting prototypes and testing with others. You establish design patterns and iterate them. You know a variety of methods of prototyping and can choose the most appropriate ones.

skills.name: Service support
skills.skill_level_description: You can help fix faults following agreed procedures. You can carry out agreed maintenance tasks on infrastructure.

skills.name: Systems design
skills.skill_level_description: You can translate logical designs into physical designs. You can produce detailed designs. You know how to document all work using required standards, methods and tools, including prototyping tools where appropriate. You can design systems characterised by managed levels of risk, manageable business and technical complexity, and meaningful impact. You can work with well understood technology and identify appropriate patterns.

skills.name: Systems integration
skills.skill_level_description: You can build and test simple interfaces between systems, or work on more complex integration as part of a wider team.

skills.name: User focus
skills.skill_level_description: You know how to collaborate with user researchers and can represent users internally. You understand the difference between user needs and the desires of the user. You can champion user research to focus on all users. You can prioritise and define approaches to understand the user story, guiding others in doing so. You can offer recommendations on the best tools and methods to be used.

levels.title: Senior developer
levels.description: A senior developer delivers and integrates software to form a complete service.
duties: plan and lead development on sets of related stories
have an understanding of the whole system and take responsibility for teaching this to others
work with other disciplines to understand what needs to be built
coach and mentor more junior colleagues
operate the production services you build
find ways to improve system robustness, resilience and stability

skills.name: Availability and capacity management

skills.name: Development process optimisation
skills.skill_level_description: You can identify process optimisation opportunities with guidance and contribute to the implementation of proposed solutions.

skills.name: Information security
skills.skill_level_description: You understand information security, and can design solutions and services with security controls embedded, specifically engineered as mitigation against security threats as a core part of the solutions and services.

levels.title: Lead developer
levels.description: A lead developer leads development on one or a small number of related project teams.
duties: guide the ways in which the team works
be proficient in a wide range of technical systems
be involved in identifying appropriate technology and approaches, deciding when software should be written
contribute to the developer community
provide technical leadership, coach and mentor your team
promote knowledge sharing and adoption of good practice

levels.title: Principal developer
levels.description: A principal developer leads and plans development across large or multiple teams.
duties: be an expert in many technical areas, or a specialist with very deep knowledge in a particular technical area
use this knowledge, and work with related disciplines, to keep multiple teams working effectively
develop capability by facilitating internal mobility, shape career paths and recruit talent, making sure they collaborate
identify, test and champion the adoption of emerging technologies

skills.name: Availability and capacity management
skills.skill_level_description: You ensure the correct implementation of standards and procedures, identifying capacity issues, stipulating the required changes and instigating these. You know how to initiate remedial action.

skills.skill_level_description: You can set strategy and manage resource allocation for solution development programmes. You liaise with client functions to establish business requirements; you can identify, propose, initiate and lead these programmes.
